page.title: 05The Sovereign Inn,Shepley.
page.content: The Sovereign Inn is over 150 years old and originally the building was the local brewery. There are three public rooms downstairs, a kitchen, six private rooms upstairs and cellars. The public house serves mainly the villages of Shepley, Cumberworth and Birds Edge as well as providing refreshment for the casual car trade. Six draught beers are stocked as well as two bitters, a mild,lager, stout,deaught cider, bottled beer and soft drinks. Family dining is very important. On an average Sunday lunchtime, fifty lunches and eighty bar meals are served. Children are allowed in if they are eating either at lunchtimes or up to 9.00 pm in the evening. The present landlord, Mr. Crowther sees an increasing need for catering for families in the future.
